content: प्रपद् {c4c} <ab>A.</ab> {@--1@} To enter upon, set forward, set foot in. {@--2@} ({%a%}) To go to or towards, approach, resort or attain to, reach; तां जन्मने शैलवधूं प्रपेदे <ls>Ku. 1. 21</ls>; (क्षितीशं) कौत्सः प्रपेदे वरतंतुशिष्यः <ls>R. 5. 1</ls>; <ls>Bk. 4. 1</ls>; <ls>Ki. 1. 9</ls>; <ls n="Ki.">11. 16</ls>; <ls>R. 8. 11.</ls> ({%b%}) To take shelter or refuge with, flee to for safety, submit; शरणार्थमन्यां कथं प्रपत्स्ये त्वयि दीप्यमाने <ls>R. 14. 64.</ls> {@--3@} To go or come to a particular state, arrive at, attain to, arrive at or be in a particular condition; रेणुः प्रपेदे पथि पंकभावं <ls>R. 16. 30</ls>; मुहूर्तकर्णोत्पलतां प्रपेदे <ls>Ku. 7. 81</ls>; बाल्यात्परं साथ वयः प्रपेदे <ls>Ku. 1. 31</ls>; <ls n="Ku.">5. 24</ls>; ईदृशीमवस्थां प्रपन्नोस्मि <ls>Ś. 5</ls>: ऋषिनिकरौरिति संशयः प्रपेदे <ls>Bv. 4. 33</ls>; <ls>Amaru. 27.</ls> {@--4@} To get, find, secure, obtain, attain to; partake of share in; सहकार न प्रपेदे मधुपेन भवत्समं जगति <ls>Bv. 1. 21</ls>; कांतं वपुर्व्योमचरं प्रपेदे <ls>R. 5. 51.</ls> {@--5@} To behave or act towards, deal with; किं प्रपद्यते वैदर्भः <ls>M. 1</ls> ‘what does he propose to do’; पश्यामो मयि किं प्रपद्यते <ls>Amaru. 20.</ls> {@--6@} To admit, allow, agree or consent to; <ls>Y. 2. 40.</ls> {@--7@} To draw near, come on, approach (as time &c.). {@--8@} To be going on, to proceed. {@--9@} To take effect, thrive, prosper. {@--10@} To throw oneself down, fall down (at another's feet). {@--11@} <ab>Ved.</ab> To attack, assault.
